page.title: 13Religion 1
page.content:
There are 7 places of worship of 4 denominations.
The Anglican church of St. Lawrence at{Scalby}was founded C11th. It has a vicar, a deaconess and a reader. It holds 4 Sunday services and one each Thursday. It has 150 communicants.
St. Mark's, also Anglican, dates from 1938. It holds 4 Sunday services, one on Wednesdays and Saints day communion for an average weekly congregation of 130, including members of the nearby {Burniston}barracks. It has its own vicar.
St. Joseph's, with a congregation of about 100, is Roman Catholic. Built in 1960, it holds one service on Saturday, one on Sunday and a Saturday confession. It has its own priest.
